tasks.description: Extend or adjust project schedule by a specified number of days due to delays (e.g., painting, plumbing, weather, material delivery, etc.)
tasks.promptTemplate: Update the schedule for [PROJECT_NAME] by [NUMBER_OF_DAYS] days due to [REASON/TRADE] delay

sequence.context: First, retrieve all project schedules to identify which project schedule needs to be updated based on the user's prompt (project name or identifier). This gives us the schedule IDs available in the system.
sequence.validation: Check that the response contains a list of project schedules with their IDs. Look for the specific project mentioned in the user's request.

sequence.context: Now that we have the schedule ID, get all the tasks within that schedule. Look for tasks related to the specific trade or reason mentioned in the prompt (e.g., painting, plumbing, electrical, etc.) that need to be delayed.
sequence.validation: Verify the response contains construction tasks with their current dates. Identify the specific tasks related to the trade/reason mentioned in the user's request.

sequence.context: Create a schedule change action item to document the schedule adjustment. Use ActionTypeId=2 (Schedule Change) with ScheduleChange object specifying NoOfDays=[from prompt] and the ConstructionTaskId from step 2. Include the reason for delay in the description.
sequence.validation: Confirm the action item was created successfully with ActionTypeId=2, and the ScheduleChange object shows the correct number of days specified in the prompt. Check that the action item includes the correct task ID and reason.

sequence.context: Actually update the project schedule task dates to reflect the specified extension. This would adjust the start/end dates of the affected task(s) and all dependent tasks by the number of days specified in the prompt.
sequence.validation: The affected task(s) and dependent tasks should have their dates pushed forward by the specified number of days. Verify the schedule reflects the changes accurately.

tasks.description: Adjust job schedule based on weather forecast (rain, extreme heat, cold, wind, etc.) that would impact outdoor work
tasks.promptTemplate: Adjust the schedule for [PROJECT_NAME] due to [WEATHER_CONDITION] forecast affecting [TASK_TYPES] work

sequence.context: Check weather forecast for the job site location to determine if adverse weather conditions (rain, extreme temperatures, high winds, etc.) are expected during scheduled outdoor work periods. Parse the user's prompt to identify which weather condition to check for.
sequence.validation: Weather data should show the specified weather condition probability and timing for the next 7-14 days relevant to the outdoor work scheduled.

sequence.context: Retrieve project schedules to identify which projects (specified in prompt or all affected projects) have outdoor work scheduled during the adverse weather forecast period.
sequence.validation: List of project schedules with their IDs is returned successfully, filtered to the project(s) mentioned in the user's request.

sequence.context: For each affected project, get the construction tasks to identify outdoor weather-sensitive tasks (concrete, roofing, painting, exterior work, etc.) that fall within the adverse weather forecast window. Focus on the task types mentioned in the prompt.
sequence.validation: Construction tasks are returned with their dates. Weather-sensitive outdoor tasks during the adverse weather period should be identified.

sequence.context: Create a schedule change action item for weather delay. Use ActionTypeId=2 with ScheduleChange specifying the number of days to delay based on weather forecast duration. Include specific weather condition and affected tasks in the description.
sequence.validation: Action item created with weather delay reason (specific weather condition from prompt) and appropriate number of days specified in ScheduleChange.

sequence.context: Reschedule the outdoor weather-sensitive tasks to after the adverse weather period, updating start/end dates accordingly. Ensure dependent tasks are also adjusted.
sequence.validation: Weather-sensitive outdoor tasks are moved to dates after the adverse weather forecast ends, and schedule shows updated dates.

tasks.description: Automate recurring weekly reports (meeting reports, status updates, summaries) for team members
tasks.promptTemplate: Generate automated weekly [REPORT_TYPE] report for [RECIPIENT/MEETING] on [DAY_OF_WEEK]

sequence.context: Gather all project management data which contains information typically needed for weekly reports (project statuses, completion percentages, timelines, etc.). This provides the base data for the report.
sequence.validation: Project management data is returned successfully with project statuses and details relevant to the requested report type.

sequence.context: Retrieve all action items from the specified time period (default: past week) to include in the status report. This shows what work was discussed, completed, or is pending.
sequence.validation: Action items from the reporting period are returned, including their status, type, and resolution for inclusion in the report.

sequence.context: Get recent proposals to include new business activity in the weekly report. This provides visibility into the sales/pipeline activity.
sequence.validation: Proposals list is returned with their current status and client information for the reporting period.

sequence.context: Format all the gathered data into the specified report template (from prompt). This would structure the data into predefined sections appropriate for the report type (e.g., meeting reports might have: projects status, action items, new proposals, issues/risks, etc.).
sequence.validation: Report is formatted according to the requested template with all required sections populated with relevant data.

sequence.context: Export the formatted report to a spreadsheet format (Excel/Google Sheets) suitable for the recipient and meeting type specified in the prompt.
sequence.validation: Spreadsheet file is created with proper formatting and all data accurately transferred in a readable format.

sequence.context: Automatically email the generated spreadsheet to the recipient(s) specified in the prompt (e.g., team member, meeting participants) on the scheduled day (e.g., every Monday morning).
sequence.validation: Email is sent successfully to correct recipients with the spreadsheet attached on the specified schedule.

tasks.description: Sort conversations by job and create weekly status reports using a pre-defined template

sequence.context: Access the conversation tracking system to retrieve all conversations/communications from the past week, organized by project/job.
sequence.validation: Conversations are successfully retrieved and can be filtered by project ID.

sequence.context: Get all action items for each project to supplement the conversation data with actual work items and their status.
sequence.validation: Action items are returned grouped by project, showing what work was discussed and completed.

sequence.context: For key action items, retrieve the comment threads to understand the conversation flow and decisions made.
sequence.validation: Comments provide context and timeline of discussions for each action item.

sequence.context: Apply the pre-defined job status report template to format the conversations and action items into a structured report for each job.
sequence.validation: Each job has a formatted status report following the template structure with all relevant information included.

sequence.context: Distribute the weekly status reports to relevant stakeholders (project managers, clients, team leads) based on their job assignments.
sequence.validation: Reports are sent to correct recipients for their respective jobs.

tasks.description: Estimate expected monthly income

sequence.context: Retrieve all active proposals to calculate potential income from proposals that are likely to be accepted this month.
sequence.validation: Proposals are returned with their total amounts and current status (pending, accepted, etc.).

sequence.context: For each proposal, get the detailed line items to understand the breakdown of income sources and payment schedules.
sequence.validation: Proposal line items show detailed pricing and can be used to calculate payment milestones.

sequence.context: Get all active projects to determine ongoing income from projects in progress, including percentage complete and remaining payments.
sequence.validation: Project data includes completion percentages and payment schedules.

sequence.context: Calculate projected monthly income based on: (1) Expected proposal acceptances with historical acceptance rate, (2) Scheduled milestone payments from active projects, (3) Completion-based payments calculated from project progress.
sequence.validation: Income projection shows breakdown by source (new proposals, active projects) with confidence levels and expected payment dates.

sequence.context: Create a formatted report showing projected income for the month with breakdown by project, proposal, and payment type.
sequence.validation: Report clearly shows total projected income, income by source, and payment timing throughout the month.

tasks.description: Report on number of homes in queue, under construction, and upcoming pipeline

sequence.context: Get comprehensive pipeline analytics showing all proposals categorized by stage (pending, accepted, in progress, completed) with counts, total values, and timeline information.
sequence.validation: Pipeline data provides complete breakdown of proposals by stage with financial metrics and timing.

sequence.context: Retrieve all active projects to count homes currently under construction and verify current work status.
sequence.validation: Project list shows active construction projects with their current status for verification.

sequence.context: Get project schedules to determine which projects are actively being worked on versus scheduled to start soon.
sequence.validation: Schedules show current vs. upcoming projects based on start dates.

sequence.context: Create a formatted summary report visualizing the pipeline with counts, total values, and expected timeline for each category: (1) Queue - proposals pending acceptance, (2) Under Construction - active projects in progress, (3) Upcoming - accepted proposals not yet started.
sequence.validation: Report shows clear metrics: number of homes in each stage, total contract values, expected start/completion dates.

tasks.description: Project gross receipts for the coming month

sequence.context: Get all active projects to calculate expected payments based on project completion and payment schedules.
sequence.validation: Projects returned with completion status and payment milestone information.

sequence.context: Retrieve recently accepted proposals that will generate initial deposits or payments in the coming month.
sequence.validation: Newly accepted proposals that haven't started yet, representing new deposit income.

sequence.context: Get all invoices to identify payments due in the next month from all active projects, including amounts, dates, and client information.
sequence.validation: Invoice list shows upcoming payments with due dates within the forecast period.

sequence.context: Check deposit/retainer balances to include expected deposit draws and remaining retainer funds available for billing.
sequence.validation: Deposit data shows available retainer funds and deposit usage patterns for revenue forecasting.

sequence.context: Calculate total gross receipts forecast by summing: (1) Scheduled milestone payments from invoices, (2) New proposal deposits, (3) Expected deposit draws, (4) Historical collection rate adjustments.
sequence.validation: Total gross receipts projection with breakdown by source and confidence intervals based on historical collection rates.

tasks.description: Provide current work-in-process status

sequence.context: Retrieve all active projects to determine which jobs are currently in process.
sequence.validation: Active projects list showing current status of each job.

sequence.context: For each active project, get the construction tasks to see which tasks are completed, in progress, and upcoming.
sequence.validation: Task lists show completion status and provide insight into work progress.

sequence.context: Get all action items for active projects, particularly cost changes and schedule changes that indicate work adjustments.
sequence.validation: Action items show recent changes, issues, and adjustments to the work in process.

sequence.context: Access QB transaction data to determine actual costs incurred on each work-in-process job, filtered by project ClassID to get spending to date.
sequence.validation: Transaction data shows actual costs spent on each WIP project by category (labor, materials, subcontractors).

sequence.context: Get current job balance for each WIP project showing the financial position (balance owed or credit available).
sequence.validation: Job balances provide current financial status for each work-in-process project.

sequence.context: Generate comprehensive WIP report showing: (1) All active projects, (2) Completion percentage, (3) Costs incurred vs. budget, (4) Current balances, (5) Estimated completion date, (6) Outstanding issues/action items.
sequence.validation: WIP report provides complete status of all ongoing work with financial and timeline metrics.

tasks.description: Give balances on supervision collected and supervision receivables

sequence.context: Get all invoices from the system to identify outstanding supervision fee invoices and paid invoices for receivables analysis.
sequence.validation: Invoice data shows amounts, dates, payment status, and aging information for all supervision fees.

sequence.context: Retrieve QB transactions filtered by supervision-related accounts to get payment collection history and calculate total collected to date.
sequence.validation: Transaction records show all supervision fee payments that have been successfully collected.

sequence.context: Get client information to associate receivables with specific clients and their supervision fee arrangements.
sequence.validation: Client data helps identify who owes supervision fees and their payment history.

sequence.context: Get current job balances to understand the financial position of each project, including amounts owed or credit available.
sequence.validation: Job balances provide per-project financial status relevant to receivables analysis.

sequence.context: Generate formatted receivables report showing supervision collected balance, supervision receivables balance, and breakdown by client with aging.
sequence.validation: Report clearly shows total collected, total receivable, and detail by client with days outstanding.

tasks.description: Provide real-time cost vs. estimate tracking report

sequence.context: Retrieve all estimates to get the original budgeted costs for each project.
sequence.validation: Estimates show original budget breakdown by category/trade.

sequence.context: Get all cost revisions for each project showing the complete history of budget changes and estimate adjustments.
sequence.validation: Cost revision history shows all budget modifications with dates, amounts, and reasons.

sequence.context: Retrieve QB transaction data filtered by project to get actual costs incurred to date, broken down by account/category (labor, materials, subcontractors).
sequence.validation: Transaction data shows actual costs spent on each project by category.

sequence.context: Calculate cost variance analysis comparing original estimate, revised estimate (with approved changes), and actual costs to date. Shows variance in dollars and percentage over/under budget.
sequence.validation: Variance report shows for each category: estimated, actual, variance in dollars and percentage.

sequence.context: Generate real-time dashboard showing cost vs. estimate status for all active projects, highlighting categories that are over/under budget.
sequence.validation: Dashboard provides immediate visibility into cost performance across all projects with red/yellow/green indicators for budget status.

tasks.description: Show history of revised estimates per job and calculate average overage

sequence.context: Get all estimates to identify the original budget for each job.
sequence.validation: Estimates list shows original budget amounts by job/project.

sequence.context: Retrieve complete revision history for each estimate showing all changes from original to current, with dates, amounts, and reasons for each revision.
sequence.validation: Estimate revision history provides complete audit trail of all budget changes per job.

sequence.context: Get detailed cost revision data for all projects to analyze revision patterns, amounts, and categories affected.
sequence.validation: Cost revision data shows amounts, categories, dates, and cumulative impact for each job.

sequence.context: Analyze the cost change history to: (1) Group revisions by job, (2) Calculate total revised amount per job, (3) Calculate overage (revised estimate - original estimate), (4) Calculate average overage across all jobs.
sequence.validation: Analysis shows per-job revision history, total overage per job, and company-wide average overage percentage.

sequence.context: Generate trend report showing revision patterns: which estimate categories most frequently require revisions, average time to revision, correlation with job type/size.
sequence.validation: Report identifies patterns in estimate revisions to help improve future estimating accuracy.

tasks.description: Send notifications to subcontractors about worksite issues, delays, schedule changes, or meeting requests

sequence.context: Retrieve subcontractor information to get contact details (phone numbers, emails) for the subcontractor(s) specified in the prompt. Use search functionality if available to find specific subcontractors by name or trade.
sequence.validation: Subcontractor list includes contact information (phone numbers, emails) for the subcontractor(s) mentioned in the user's request.

sequence.context: Get action items related to the issue, delay, or topic that requires subcontractor notification. This provides context for the communication.
sequence.validation: Action items show the specific issues/delays/changes that need to be communicated to the subcontractor.

sequence.context: Send SMS text messages to the specified subcontractor(s) to notify them of worksite issues, delays, schedule changes, or to schedule meetings. Include relevant details from the prompt and action items.
sequence.validation: SMS successfully sent to correct subcontractor phone number(s) with the specified issue/meeting/delay details.

sequence.context: Create a follow-up action item (ActionTypeId=6) to track the subcontractor notification and any required response or meeting. Include the subcontractor name and topic in the action item.
sequence.validation: Follow-up action item created referencing the subcontractor and the issue/topic communicated, with appropriate due date.

sequence.context: Log the communication in a central system for tracking all subcontractor interactions, messages sent, and their responses for future reference.
sequence.validation: Communication logged with timestamp, recipient subcontractor, message content, and any response received.

tasks.description: Send estimates, updates, proposals, or other communications to clients via email or text

sequence.context: Search for the specific client(s) mentioned in the prompt to get their contact information (email address, phone number). Use search functionality to find clients by name.
sequence.validation: Client records returned with email addresses and phone numbers for the client(s) specified in the request.

sequence.context: Get the proposals/estimates associated with the client and topic mentioned in the prompt. Filter by client to find relevant proposals or estimates that need to be sent.
sequence.validation: Proposals retrieved showing estimate details and amounts for the specified client and project/topic.

sequence.context: Generate professional PDF versions of the estimates, proposals, or documents that need to be sent to the client based on the communication type specified in the prompt.
sequence.validation: PDF files created with proper formatting showing all relevant details (estimate, proposal, update, etc.).

sequence.context: Send email to the client with the document (PDF, estimate, etc.) attached, including professional message text relevant to the communication type (estimate delivery, project update, etc.).
sequence.validation: Email sent successfully to correct client email address with appropriate attachments and message content.

sequence.context: Optionally send SMS notification to client to alert them that an email has been sent or to provide brief updates, depending on the communication type and client preference.
sequence.validation: SMS sent to client with appropriate notification or brief update message.

sequence.context: Create client contact action item (ActionTypeId=3) to track the communication sent and schedule any required follow-up based on the communication type.
sequence.validation: Action item created documenting the communication (type, content, recipient) and setting appropriate follow-up date if needed.

tasks.description: Call or text spouse or staff members (e.g., send flowers, disciplinary messages, etc.)

sequence.context: Access personal contacts database to get phone numbers for spouse, staff members, and other personal contacts.
sequence.validation: Personal contact information retrieved successfully.

sequence.context: Send text messages to personal contacts for various purposes (reminders, personal notes, etc.).
sequence.validation: SMS sent successfully to correct recipient.

sequence.context: Initiate phone calls to personal contacts when voice communication is needed.
sequence.validation: Phone call initiated to correct number.

sequence.context: Integrate with flower delivery service API to order and send flowers to spouse or others.
sequence.validation: Flower order placed successfully with delivery details confirmed.

sequence.context: Create reminder action items (ActionTypeId=7) for important personal tasks or follow-ups.
sequence.validation: Reminder action item created with appropriate due date and description.

tasks.description: Send job site photos to Becca and ensure they are posted on Instagram by week's end

sequence.context: Access job site photo storage to retrieve recent photos that should be shared on social media.
sequence.validation: Job site photos retrieved with metadata (date, project, location).

sequence.context: Email selected job site photos to Becca with instructions for Instagram posting.
sequence.validation: Email sent to Becca with photo attachments and posting instructions.

sequence.context: Create a follow-up action item (ActionTypeId=6) with due date end of week to ensure photos are posted to Instagram.
sequence.validation: Follow-up action item created with end-of-week due date for Instagram posting verification.

sequence.context: Optionally integrate directly with Instagram API to schedule posts or verify posting was completed.
sequence.validation: Instagram posting verified or scheduled successfully.

sequence.context: Add comment to the follow-up action item once Instagram posting is confirmed.
sequence.validation: Comment added confirming Instagram post completion with post URL/details.

tasks.description: Create estimates using pricing formulas (e.g., sod, irrigation, trees) and send to clients

sequence.context: Use pricing formulas to calculate costs for landscape items: sod ($/sq ft), irrigation ($/sq ft or per zone), trees (per unit), etc.
sequence.validation: Pricing calculated based on square footage, quantities, and standard rates.

sequence.context: Build comprehensive estimate using the calculated landscape pricing, including labor, materials, and markup.
sequence.validation: Complete landscape estimate created with itemized pricing for all components.

sequence.context: Retrieve client information for the landscape estimate recipient.
sequence.validation: Client contact information retrieved for estimate delivery.

sequence.context: Generate professional PDF of the landscape estimate.
sequence.validation: PDF estimate created with professional formatting.

sequence.context: Email the landscape estimate PDF to the client.
sequence.validation: Email sent successfully to client with estimate attached.

sequence.context: Create client contact action item (ActionTypeId=3) to track estimate delivery and follow-up.
sequence.validation: Action item created for tracking estimate follow-up with client.

tasks.description: Prepare and email estimates for driveways and similar work

sequence.context: Calculate costs for hardscape work: concrete/pavers ($/sq ft), excavation, base prep, drainage, finishing, etc.
sequence.validation: Hardscape pricing calculated with all components (materials, labor, equipment).

sequence.context: Create detailed hardscape estimate including site preparation, materials, labor, and timeline.
sequence.validation: Complete estimate with itemized pricing and project timeline.

sequence.context: Get client contact information for estimate delivery.
sequence.validation: Client email address retrieved.

sequence.context: Generate PDF of hardscape estimate with diagrams/plans if available.
sequence.validation: Professional PDF estimate created.

sequence.context: Email hardscape estimate to client with detailed explanation.
sequence.validation: Email sent with estimate PDF attached.

sequence.context: Create action item to track estimate follow-up.
sequence.validation: Follow-up action item created with due date.

tasks.description: Report how far a job is over budget, including amount and percentage

sequence.context: Get the original estimate/budget for the specific job.
sequence.validation: Original budget retrieved with breakdown by category.

sequence.context: Retrieve all cost revisions for the job to get complete history of budget adjustments.
sequence.validation: All budget adjustments retrieved with dates, amounts, and categories.

sequence.context: Get QB transaction data filtered by project ClassID to retrieve actual costs spent on the job to date, broken down by account/category.
sequence.validation: Actual costs show all expenditures by category (labor, materials, subcontractors, etc.).

sequence.context: Calculate budget variance showing: (1) Original estimate, (2) Revised estimate with all changes, (3) Actual costs to date, (4) Variance amount and percentage over/under budget.
sequence.validation: Report shows job is $X over budget (Y% over revised budget) with detailed variance by category.

tasks.description: Track owner deposits and current balance on specific job accounts

sequence.context: Access deposit/retainer tracking to get initial owner deposits for each job/project, including deposit amounts and usage to date.
sequence.validation: Deposit records show initial deposit amounts, amounts used, and current balances for all projects.

sequence.context: Get detailed deposit information for specific project, showing initial deposit, all draws/payments made against it, and remaining balance.
sequence.validation: Detailed deposit data shows complete payment history and current balance for the project.

sequence.context: Retrieve QB transactions filtered by deposit/retainer accounts to see detailed payment history and draws made against deposits.
sequence.validation: Transaction history shows all amounts withdrawn from deposit accounts with dates and descriptions.

sequence.context: Get project information to associate deposits with specific jobs and clients for comprehensive reporting.
sequence.validation: Project data provides context linking deposits to job details and client information.

sequence.context: Generate formatted report showing: initial deposit, payments to date, current balance, and percentage of deposit used for each job.
sequence.validation: Report clearly shows deposit status for each job account with usage percentages.

tasks.description: Trigger invoice request when 80% of retainer has been used

sequence.context: Monitor retainer/deposit balances for all active projects to calculate percentage used for each project.
sequence.validation: Deposit data shows initial amount, used amount, remaining balance, and percentage consumed.

sequence.context: Get project details to associate retainer usage with specific jobs/clients.
sequence.validation: Project data linked to retainer accounts.

sequence.context: Automated monitoring service that triggers alerts when retainer usage exceeds 80% threshold.
sequence.validation: Alert triggered when threshold is reached.

sequence.context: Create reminder action item (ActionTypeId=7) to request additional retainer/invoice from owner.
sequence.validation: Reminder action item created with details of retainer status and amount needed.

sequence.context: Send email notification to accounting/admin staff about retainer threshold being reached.
sequence.validation: Email sent with retainer status and invoice request instructions.

tasks.description: Average cost and duration of specific job types (e.g., flooring, framing, insulation) from historical jobs

sequence.context: Retrieve all completed projects to build historical database for benchmarking.
sequence.validation: Historical project data includes completion dates and project types.

sequence.context: Access QB transaction history for completed projects broken down by account/category to get actual costs by trade/task type (flooring, framing, insulation, etc.).
sequence.validation: Transaction history shows actual costs by category across multiple completed projects.

sequence.context: Retrieve schedule revision history to understand actual duration data for tasks, including delays and adjustments that affected completion times.
sequence.validation: Schedule revision data provides insight into actual task durations and timeline variations from historical projects.

sequence.context: Calculate benchmarks: (1) Average cost by task type, (2) Average duration by task type, (3) Cost/duration by project size, (4) Standard deviation and ranges.
sequence.validation: Statistical analysis provides reliable averages and ranges for each job type.

sequence.context: Generate benchmark report showing average costs and durations for each task type, useful for estimating future projects.
sequence.validation: Report shows clear benchmarks: Task X averages $Y and Z days based on N historical projects.

tasks.description: Break down costs by trade (e.g., drywall, lumber, paint, etc.) based on square footage

sequence.context: Retrieve comprehensive project details including total square footage, project specifications, and metadata for each completed project.
sequence.validation: Project details include square footage data available for cost/sqft calculations.

sequence.context: Get QB transaction data for each project broken down by account/category to get detailed cost breakdown by trade (drywall, lumber, paint, etc.).
sequence.validation: Transaction data provides costs itemized by trade/material category for each project.

sequence.context: Calculate cost per square foot for each trade: Trade Cost / Total Square Feet = $/sqft by trade.
sequence.validation: Cost per sqft calculated for each trade across projects.

sequence.context: Compare cost/sqft across multiple projects to identify trends, outliers, and averages by trade.
sequence.validation: Analysis shows which projects had high/low costs per sqft and why.

sequence.context: Generate report showing cost breakdown per square foot by trade, with project comparisons and averages.
sequence.validation: Report clearly shows $/sqft for each trade with project-by-project and average data.

tasks.description: Create and label 'revised estimates' instead of 'change orders' for cost-plus jobs

sequence.context: Retrieve all cost revisions which represent changes to the original estimate, providing complete revision history per job.
sequence.validation: Cost revisions retrieved showing all estimate changes with dates, amounts, and categories.

sequence.context: Get comprehensive estimate revision history showing progression from original to current estimate with all intermediate changes.
sequence.validation: Revision history provides complete audit trail of estimate changes over time.

sequence.context: Create general change order action items (ActionTypeId=8) but label them as 'Revised Estimates' in the title/description for cost-plus jobs.
sequence.validation: Action items created with 'Revised Estimate' terminology appropriate for cost-plus contracts.

sequence.context: Add detailed cost change data to track revision amount, category affected, and reason for change in a structured format.
sequence.validation: Cost change data captured showing specific amounts and categories for the revision.

sequence.context: Generate 'Revised Estimate' reports (avoiding 'change order' language) showing current budget including all approved revisions.
sequence.validation: Report uses 'Revised Estimate' terminology and shows clear progression from original to current estimate.

tasks.description: Price out client upgrade requests (fixtures, materials, features, quantities) and revise estimate accordingly
tasks.promptTemplate: Price upgrade for [ITEM/FEATURE] from [STANDARD_OPTION] to [UPGRADE_OPTION] for [CLIENT_NAME/PROJECT]

sequence.context: Access standard pricing templates to get baseline costs for common upgrade categories (fixtures, materials, features) with predefined rates and line items.
sequence.validation: Template pricing data retrieved showing standard rates for common upgrade categories.

sequence.context: Calculate upgrade cost differential: (Upgrade Item Cost - Standard Item Cost) + Additional Labor + Installation Differences = Net Upgrade Cost. Use the standard and upgrade options specified in the prompt.
sequence.validation: Upgrade pricing calculated showing incremental cost vs. standard option for the items specified in the request.

sequence.context: Create cost change action item (ActionTypeId=1) documenting the upgrade request, the items being upgraded (from prompt), and the cost impact on the estimate.
sequence.validation: Cost change action item created with upgrade details (item names, quantities) and pricing from the calculation.

sequence.context: Add cost change data to the action item specifying the upgrade amount calculated and the affected estimate category (fixtures, materials, labor, etc.).
sequence.validation: Cost change data added showing upgrade amount and the specific estimate category being affected.

sequence.context: Generate revised estimate incorporating the approved upgrade pricing, showing the original estimate, upgrade costs, and new total. Include itemized breakdown of upgrades.
sequence.validation: Updated estimate shows new total with upgrade(s) itemized, making it clear what changed from the original estimate.

sequence.context: Get client information for the client/project specified in the prompt to send the revised estimate with upgrade pricing.
sequence.validation: Client contact info retrieved for delivering the revised estimate with upgrade pricing.

tasks.description: Parse emails from contacts (architects, engineers, vendors) and extract key information and attachments
tasks.promptTemplate: Parse email from [SENDER_NAME/TYPE] regarding [PROJECT_NAME/TOPIC] and extract [INFORMATION_NEEDED]

sequence.context: Connect to email system (Gmail, Outlook, etc.) to access emails from the specific sender or sender type mentioned in the prompt (e.g., architects, engineers, vendors, clients). Search by sender name or email address.
sequence.validation: Email access established and emails from the specified sender/sender type retrieved successfully.

sequence.context: Parse email content to extract key information relevant to the prompt: project name, dates, requirements, changes, specifications, decisions, etc. Focus on extracting the specific information requested in the prompt.
sequence.validation: Email text parsed successfully with requested key data points extracted (dates, requirements, changes, etc.).

sequence.context: Extract attachments from the email (PDF plans, CAD files, spreadsheets, images, etc.) and save to the appropriate project folder. Identify file types and organize accordingly.
sequence.validation: Attachments downloaded and associated with correct project, properly organized by file type.

sequence.context: Use OCR (Optical Character Recognition) to extract text and data from attached PDF documents (plans, specifications, invoices, etc.) to make content searchable and analyzable.
sequence.validation: Text, specifications, and data successfully extracted from PDF attachments.

sequence.context: Create note action item (ActionTypeId=5) documenting the email content, sender, extracted information, and attached documents for project records. Include summary of key points from the email.
sequence.validation: Action item created with email summary, sender information, extracted data points, and links/references to saved attachments.

tasks.description: From building plans, count doors, windows, cabinets, and generate quantity takeoffs

sequence.context: Upload or access building plan files (PDF, CAD, image files).
sequence.validation: Plan files loaded into analysis system.

sequence.context: Use AI/ML to analyze plans and identify architectural elements: doors, windows, cabinets, rooms, dimensions.
sequence.validation: AI successfully identifies and counts major plan elements.

sequence.context: Generate quantity takeoffs: count of doors by type/size, windows by type/size, linear feet of cabinets, square footage by room, etc.
sequence.validation: Detailed quantity takeoff showing counts and measurements of all elements.

sequence.context: Convert quantity takeoffs into material estimates using standard formulas (e.g., sqft of drywall, linear feet of trim, etc.).
sequence.validation: Material quantities calculated based on plan measurements.

sequence.context: Generate comprehensive takeoff report showing all quantities, measurements, and preliminary material estimates.
sequence.validation: Report provides complete quantity takeoff ready for pricing/estimating.

tasks.description: Alert for unprocessed action items older than 24 hours

sequence.context: Retrieve all action items to analyze their creation dates and current status.
sequence.validation: All action items returned with DateCreated and Status fields.

sequence.context: Filter action items to find those created more than 24 hours ago that still have Status=1 (Open) or Status=2 (In Progress) without recent updates.
sequence.validation: Filtered list shows only unprocessed action items older than 24 hours.

sequence.context: For each old unprocessed item, get full details including comments to understand if there's been any activity.
sequence.validation: Full action item data shows whether item is truly stagnant or has recent activity in comments.

sequence.context: Send alert notifications (email, SMS, dashboard) about unprocessed action items to responsible supervisors/managers.
sequence.validation: Alerts sent to appropriate personnel listing overdue action items.

sequence.context: Generate daily report of all missed/overdue action items for management review.
sequence.validation: Report shows actionable list of items requiring attention with age and assigned personnel.

tasks.description: Summarize critical company updates or issues the owner might not be aware of

sequence.context: Analyze all recent action items to identify critical issues, cost changes, and schedule delays.
sequence.validation: Action items show potential problem areas and critical updates.

sequence.context: Review all cost changes to identify budget overruns that may not have been escalated to owner.
sequence.validation: Cost changes reveal budget issues that need owner attention.

sequence.context: Review schedule changes to identify cumulative delays across projects.
sequence.validation: Schedule changes show project timeline issues needing escalation.

sequence.context: AI analysis to identify patterns and issues that may indicate blind spots: (1) Recurring problems not being addressed, (2) Cumulative small issues becoming big problems, (3) Communication gaps, (4) Unreported delays/overruns.
sequence.validation: Analysis identifies potential blind spots and areas requiring owner awareness.

sequence.context: Generate executive summary report highlighting critical issues, trends, and recommendations that owner should be aware of.
sequence.validation: Concise report provides owner with visibility into potential blind spots and action needed.

tasks.description: Analyze potential new markets or geographic areas and propose market expansion strategy
tasks.promptTemplate: Analyze market opportunity in [GEOGRAPHIC_AREA/MARKET_TYPE] and propose expansion strategy for [SERVICE_TYPE]

sequence.context: Use GIS/mapping services to identify and map the target geographic area or market mentioned in the prompt. Gather demographic, economic, and relevant geographic data for the area.
sequence.validation: Geographic data retrieved showing the extent and characteristics of the target market area specified in the request.

sequence.context: Access property and market databases to estimate market size, number of potential projects, property values, and reconstruction/construction potential in the target area. Focus on the service type mentioned in the prompt.
sequence.validation: Market data shows size, opportunity, and potential project volume in the target area for the specified service type.

sequence.context: Research competitive landscape, regulatory requirements (permitting, licensing), market demand drivers, and any unique factors relevant to the target market (insurance, environmental, economic factors).
sequence.validation: Market research provides comprehensive competitive landscape and identifies entry barriers and opportunities specific to the target area.

sequence.context: Analyze market opportunity using gathered data: (1) Estimated demand and project volume, (2) Competition level and market saturation, (3) Required resources, expertise, and investment, (4) Profit potential and margins, (5) Risks and challenges specific to this market.
sequence.validation: Strategic analysis provides clear go/no-go recommendation with supporting data, financial projections, and risk assessment.

sequence.context: Generate comprehensive market expansion strategy document: target segments within the area, messaging and positioning, outreach methods and channels, potential partnerships, implementation timeline, and budget requirements.
sequence.validation: Detailed strategy document ready for review including actionable steps, resource requirements, and expected outcomes.

tasks.description: Research competitor products/services to identify features, capabilities, and opportunities for improvement

sequence.context: Use web scraping tools to systematically collect information from the competitor's website (specified in prompt) about their features, pricing, capabilities, and value propositions.
sequence.validation: Website content scraped including feature descriptions, screenshots, documentation, and any publicly available information about the competitor.

sequence.context: Analyze scraped content to extract and categorize the competitor's features by functional areas (e.g., project management, scheduling, budgeting, client communication, reporting, etc.). Create structured list of capabilities.
sequence.validation: Comprehensive list of competitor features organized by category with descriptions of functionality.

sequence.context: Compare the competitor's features against current JoeAPI/system capabilities to identify gaps, opportunities for improvement, and areas where we have advantages. Note features we have, lack, or could enhance.
sequence.validation: Gap analysis clearly shows competitive positioning: which features we have, lack, or could improve relative to the competitor.

sequence.context: Prioritize identified features and improvements based on: (1) User demand and business value, (2) Development effort and complexity, (3) Competitive advantage potential, (4) Strategic fit with product vision.
sequence.validation: Prioritized list of features/improvements to develop, ranked by value/feasibility ratio with clear rationale.

sequence.context: Generate product development roadmap showing which competitor features to implement or improve upon, including timeline, resource requirements, and expected business impact.
sequence.validation: Roadmap provides clear development plan with phases, timelines, resource allocation, and expected outcomes for achieving competitive parity or advantage.
